content: breakpointhook() pdb. set_trace() pdb sys. breakpointhook() breakpoint() sys. breakpointhook() RuntimeError By default, the behavior of breakpoint() can be changed with the PYTHONBREAKPOINT environment variable. See sys. breakpointhook() for usage details. breakpoint() PYTHONBREAKPOINT sys. breakpointhook() Note that this is not guaranteed if sys. breakpointhook() has been replaced. sys. breakpointhook() Raises an auditing event builtins. breakpoint with argument breakpointhook. builtins. breakpoint breakpointhook Added in version 3. 7. Return a new array of bytes. The bytearray class is a mutable sequence of integers in the range 0 <= x < 256. It has most of the usual methods of mutable sequences, described in Mutable Sequence Types, as well as most methods that the bytes type has, see Bytes and Bytearray Operations. bytearray bytes The optional source parameter can be used to initialize the array in a few different ways: If it is a string, you must also give the encoding (and optionally, errors) parameters; bytearray() then converts the string to bytes using str. encode(). If it is a string, you must also give the encoding (and optionally, errors) parameters; bytearray() then converts the string to bytes using str. encode(). bytearray() str. encode() If it is an integer, the array will have that size and will be initialized with null bytes. If it is an integer, the array will have that size and will be initialized with null bytes. If it is an object conforming to the buffer interface, a read-only buffer of the object will be used to initialize the bytes array. If it is an object conforming to the buffer interface, a read-only buffer of the object will be used to initialize the bytes array. If it is an iterable, it must be an iterable of integers in the range 0 <= x < 256, which are used as the initial contents of the array. If it is an iterable, it must be an iterable of integers in the range 0 <= x < 256, which are used as the initial contents of the array. 0 <= x < 256 Without an argument, an array of size 0 is created. See also Binary Sequence Types â€” bytes, bytearray, memoryview and Bytearray Objects.
title: Built-in Functions.13.5
